title: Quantum Quantitative Trading: High-Frequency Statistical Arbitrage Algorithm
abstract:
Abstract
Quantitative trading is an integral part of financial markets with high calculation speed requirements, while no quantum algorithms have been introduced into this field yet. We propose quantum algorithms for high-frequency statistical arbitrage trading in this work by utilizing variable time condition number estimation and quantum linear regression. The algorithm complexity has been reduced from the classical benchmark O​(N2​d)𝑂superscript𝑁2𝑑O(N^{2}d) to O(dκ02log⁡((1/ϵ))2))O(\sqrt{d}\kappa_{0}^{2}\log{(1/\epsilon)}^{2})). It shows quantum advantage, where N𝑁N is the length of trading data, and d𝑑d is the number of stocks, κ0subscript𝜅0\kappa_{0} is the condition number and ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilon is the desired precision. Moreover, two tool algorithms for condition number estimation and cointegration test are developed.
